meanings.definition: Start a line of text further from the margin than the other lines.
meanings.sent1: She will indent the first line of the paragraph to make it stand out.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to indent each new paragraph in your essay.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to indent their essays, but one student indented the wrong way.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness indents deeply in my heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The indentation in the sand showed where the turtle had nested.

meanings.definition: A space left between the margin and the start of a line of text.
meanings.sent1: The indent in the document made it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: Make sure there is an indent at the beginning of each paragraph.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot in the indent of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The indent in the wall was the perfect size for a small statue.
meanings.sent5: The indent on the paper gave it a professional look.

meanings.definition: A notch or recess in an edge or surface.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter created a beautiful indent in the wood.
meanings.sent2: The indent on the metal sheet added a decorative touch.
meanings.sent3: She found a hidden indent in the rock where she could place her treasure.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast a shadow into the indent of the cave.
meanings.sent5: The indent in the sidewalk collected rainwater after the storm.
